subject: Investing
title: Confirmation Bias: Seeing What You Want
description: Learn Confirmation Bias: Seeing What You Want in one minute.

hook.text: An investor bullish on a company read ten articles praising it and ignored five warning it was overvalued.

buildup.text: Confirmation bias makes you seek information that supports your existing belief and dismiss what challenges it.

discovery.text: Online algorithms reinforce the problem by feeding you more of what you already clicked on.

twist.text: The best investors actively seek disconfirming evidenceâ€”reasons they might be wrong.

climax.text: Before buying any investment, list three reasons it could fail. If you can't, you haven't researched enough.

punchline.text: Seek the argument against your own position. That's where truth hides.

quiz.question: What does confirmation bias cause investors to do?
options: Favor information that supports existing beliefs
